main.name: Imran Matin
main.description: I love solving challenging problems, pushing myself outside of my comfort zone and enjoying life while I am at it too
main.bio: I am avid soccer player who loves to exercise. During the past couple of years I have been at UC San Diego where I have been exploring my interests in Computer Science, entrepreneurship, and surfing! I am now looking towards the future to see what I can achieve and how I can make my impact on the world.
main.contactmessage: Please contact me through email, using the email address on the site.

resume.skillmessage: Technologies that I've enjoyed working with since I started programming in 2016.

education.description: By entering the school as an undeclared major, then studying data science for two years, then converting to computer science, I have learned a lot at UC San Diego. I played on the UCSD Men's Club Soccer Team and was in my fraternity, Tau Kappa Epsilon, for all four years.

work.title: Computer Science Tutor
work.description: I love to tutor students at UCSD as it was really what got me to where I am today in my studies. I have tutored Data Science courses in Python and Computer Science courses in C.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: I worked on the Cloud Technologies Team at Apple. I worked alongside Apple and Google Cloud engineers to bring the Google Cloud Platform to Apple.

work.company: Scripps Institute of Oceanography, Innovative Marine Technology Lab
work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: I assisted in research under Dale Stokes and Grant Deane. I designed and implemented a complex system containing multiple onboard Linux computers, sensors, and cameras for a semi-autonomous marine research machine.

work.title: Data Science Intern
work.description: I joined this startup to explore the field of Data Science, and I learned about how to process and clean big data.

work.title: Cloud Communications and Solutions Developer Intern
work.description: I automated testing practices using Ansible as well as developed an application that seamlessly integrated failed test results from Ansible tests into JIRA bugs.

projects.title: Canadian Wanderlust
projects.category: My Travel Blog for my post-university travels
